examples: something is wrong with the engine

results.definition: away from the correct or expected course
examples: something has gone awry in our plans
something went badly amiss in the preparations

results.definition: in an improper or mistaken or unfortunate manner
examples: if you think him guilty you judge amiss
no one took it amiss when she spoke frankly

results.definition: in an imperfect or faulty way
examples: Miss Bennet would not play at all amiss if she practiced more"- Jane Austen
